summary: This is an email chain from July 6, 2020, regarding the pretrial intake for Ghislaine Maxwell following her arrest. It includes a completed intake form detailing her charges, legal representation, and housing location, and notes her upcoming arraignment and bail hearing.

persons.name: Natasha Ramesar
persons.context: Sends an email requesting a contact number and instructing on copying protocol when coordinating with defense counsel regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, with listed charges including conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. She is scheduled for arraignment and a bail hearing.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys on the pretrial intake form.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys on the pretrial intake form.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge before whom Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing are scheduled.

connections.description: Chris Everdell is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell on the pretrial intake form.
Mark Cohen is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell on the pretrial intake form.
Ramesar, a U.S. Pretrial Services officer, is coordinating the intake process for the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell's Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to be arraigned and have a bail hearing before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival in SDNY
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York and was expected to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and arrived in the Southern District of New York on or about July 6, 2020, and was to be housed at the MDC.
She faced a six-count indictment including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Her arraignment and bail hearing were scheduled for July 10, 2020, before Judge Nathan.
Her retained defense attorneys were listed as Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
The document includes a government motion for detention, indicating prosecutors sought to hold her without bail.
